poem.author: peter McCarey
poem.text:
Dusk in furs
Realm of the blind
Tingent senses
Dunk in mother's perfume
Fifty years
When "duck and cover"
Was Cold War safety drill;
Ironed linen hankies
(No more since Suez) against
The thermonuclear sneeze.
Commuter exodus of mind and vision
On the hour
And the odd, exilic drunk.
